page.title: 12MORDIFORD RECREATION
page.content: Most of the recreational sports in the area are tied in with the tourist industry. Some of the privately owned woods have been made more profitable by using them as game-sport areas. The owners rear pheasants & release them on to their land charging people to come & shoot. At the end of the day the pheasants are often not kept by the "guns" but are sold to wholesalers & by them to London hotels. A days shooting can cost up to Â£300. It is also a good area for migrating Woodcock which are shot as they fly over. On the River Wye there is salmon fishing, & coarse fishing on the Lugg Another pastime on the river is canoeing - near the new river bridge just outside Mordiford. Horse riding is also popular in the surrounding area.
